data.name: Ivysaur
data.flavorText: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.

attacks.name: Summoning Aroma
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Radiant Venusaur
data.flavorText: Its plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.
rules: Radiant Pokémon Rule: You can't have more than 1 Radiant Pokémon in your deck.

abilities.name: Sunny Bloom
abilities.text: Once at the end of your turn (after your attack), you may use this Ability. Draw cards until you have 4 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Pollen Hazard
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned, Confused, and Poisoned.

data.name: Ariados
data.flavorText: It spews threads from its mouth to catch its prey. When night falls, it leaves its web to go hunt aggressively.

attacks.name: Poison String-Up
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 50 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Charmander
data.flavorText: It has a preference for hot things. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

attacks.name: Tail on Fire
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Charmeleon
data.flavorText: It has a barbaric nature. In battle, it whips its fiery tail around and slashes away with sharp claws.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Radiant Charizard
data.flavorText: It spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. It may cause forest fires by blowing flames.
rules: Radiant Pokémon Rule: You can't have more than 1 Radiant Pokémon in your deck.

abilities.name: Excited Heart
abilities.text: This Pokémon's attacks cost Colorless less for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

attacks.name: Combustion Blast
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Combustion Blast.

data.name: Golisopod
data.flavorText: It will do anything to win, taking advantage of every opening and finishing opponents off with the small claws on its front legs.

attacks.name: First Impression
attacks.text: If this Pokémon moved from your Bench to the Active Spot this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Lunatone
data.flavorText: The phase of the moon apparently has some effect on its power. It's active on the night of a full moon.

attacks.name: Cycle Draw
attacks.text: Discard a card from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Moon Kinesis
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Psychic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Sylveon
data.flavorText: By releasing enmity-erasing waves from its ribbonlike feelers, Sylveon stops any conflict.

attacks.name: Souvenir
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Wonder Flash
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Dragon Pokémon, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Alolan Raticate
data.flavorText: It commands a nest of Rattata. Different nests don't get along, whipping up severe fights over feeding grounds.

attacks.name: Chase Up
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Super Fang
attacks.text: Put damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon until its remaining HP is 10.

data.name: Steelix
data.flavorText: It is said that if an Onix lives for over 100 years, its composition changes to become diamond-like.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Iron Buster
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Spinarak
data.flavorText: Although the poison from its fangs isn't that strong, it's potent enough to weaken prey that gets caught in its web.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Moltres
data.flavorText: It's one of the legendary bird Pokémon. When Moltres flaps its flaming wings, they glimmer with a dazzling red glow.

abilities.name: Flare Symbol
abilities.text: Your Basic Fire Pokémon's attacks, except any Moltres, do 10 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Squirtle
data.flavorText: When it retracts its long neck into its shell, it squirts out water with vigorous force.

data.name: Wartortle
data.flavorText: It is recognized as a symbol of longevity. If its shell has algae on it, that Wartortle is very old.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Blastoise
data.flavorText: It crushes its foe under its heavy body to cause fainting. In a pinch, it will withdraw inside its shell.

abilities.name: Vitality Spring
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 6 Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Slowbro
data.flavorText: Slowpoke became Slowbro when a Shellder bit on to its tail. Sweet flavors seeping from the tail make the Shellder feel as if its life is a dream.

attacks.name: Tumbling Tackle
attacks.text: Both Active Pokémon are now Asleep.

attacks.name: Twilight Inspiration
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if your opponent has exactly 1 Prize card remaining. Take 2 Prize cards.

data.name: Magikarp
data.flavorText: It is virtually worthless in terms of both power and speed. It is the most weak and pathetic Pokémon in the world.

attacks.name: Lively Grouping
attacks.text: Search your deck for any number of Magikarp, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Raging Fin
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Magikarp and Gyarados in your discard pile.

data.name: Gyarados
data.flavorText: It has an extremely aggressive nature. The Hyper Beam it shoots from its mouth totally incinerates all targets.

attacks.name: Wreak Havoc
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Wild Splash
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck.

data.name: Lapras
data.flavorText: A smart and kindhearted Pokémon, it glides across the surface of the sea while its beautiful song echoes around it.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Pikachu
data.flavorText: Pikachu that can generate powerful electricity have cheek sacs that are extra soft and super stretchy.

attacks.name: Wild Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Mewtwo V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Transfer Break
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Natu
data.flavorText: It is extremely good at climbing tree trunks and likes to eat the new sprouts on the trees.

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Pupitar
data.flavorText: Even sealed in its shell, it can move freely. Hard and fast, it has outstanding destructive power.

attacks.name: Crashing Bullet
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Solrock
data.flavorText: When it rotates itself, it gives off light similar to the sun, thus blinding its foes.

abilities.name: Sun Energy
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Psychic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Lunatone.

data.name: Conkeldurr V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Counter
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does that much more damage.

attacks.name: Dynamic Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 90 more damage, and your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Tyranitar
data.flavorText: Its body can't be harmed by any sort of attack, so it is very eager to make challenges against enemies.

attacks.name: Raging Crash
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage for each damage counter on all of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Melmetal
data.flavorText: Revered long ago for its capacity to create iron from nothing, for some reason it has come back to life after 3,000 years.

attacks.name: Swinging Smash
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 90 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Melmetal V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Arm Charge
attacks.text: You may attach a Metal Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon.

data.name: Camerupt
data.flavorText: If angered, the humps on its back erupt in a shower of molten lava. It lives in the craters of volcanoes.

attacks.name: Split Bomb
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Radiant Blastoise
data.flavorText: It crushes its foe under its heavy body to cause fainting. In a pinch, it will withdraw inside its shell.
rules: Radiant Pokémon Rule: You can't have more than 1 Radiant Pokémon in your deck.

abilities.name: Pump Shot
abilities.text: You must discard a Water Energy card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Torrential Cannon
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Torrential Cannon.

data.name: Slowpoke
data.flavorText: Slow-witted and oblivious, this Pokémon won't feel any pain if its tail gets eaten. It won't notice when its tail grows back, either.

attacks.name: Hold Still
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ideal Fishing Day
attacks.text: Put an Item card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Zapdos
data.flavorText: This Pokémon has complete control over electricity. There are tales of Zapdos nesting in the dark depths of pitch-black thunderclouds.

abilities.name: Lightning Symbol
abilities.text: Your Basic Lightning Pokémon's attacks, except any Zapdos, do 10 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Mewtwo VSTAR
rules: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Psy Purge
attacks.text: Discard up to 3 Psychic Energy from your Pokémon. This attack does 90 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Star Raid
attacks.text: This attack does 120 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon V. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

data.name: Xatu
data.flavorText: They say that it stays still and quiet because it is seeing both the past and future at the same time.

attacks.name: Pinpoint Wave
attacks.text: This attack does 90 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon V. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Larvitar
data.flavorText: Born deep underground, it comes aboveground and becomes a pupa once it has finished eating the surrounding soil.

attacks.name: Rock Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.name: Dragonite V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Bulbasaur
data.flavorText: There is a plant seed on its back right from the day this Pokémon is born. The seed slowly grows larger.

data.name: Venusaur
data.flavorText: Its plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

abilities.name: Loopy Lasso
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon, and the new Active Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

data.name: Alolan Exeggutor V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Growing Tall
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for up to 5 Grass Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Head Swing
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon for each Grass Energy attached to this Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Charizard
data.flavorText: It spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. It may cause forest fires by blowing flames.

abilities.name: Burn Brightly
abilities.text: Each basic Fire Energy attached to your Pokémon provides FireFire Energy. You can't apply more than 1 Burn Brightly Ability at a time.

attacks.name: Flare Blitz
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Numel
data.flavorText: The magma in its body reaches 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit. Its hump gets smaller when it uses Fire-type moves.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.name: Articuno
data.flavorText: It's said that this Pokémon's beautiful blue wings are made of ice. Articuno flies over snowy mountains, its long tail fluttering along behind it.

abilities.name: Ice Symbol
abilities.text: Your Basic Water Pokémon's attacks, except any Articuno, do 10 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Wimpod
data.flavorText: It's nature's cleaner—it eats anything and everything, including garbage and rotten things. The ground near its nest is always clean.

abilities.name: Punk Out
abilities.text: If your opponent has any Pokémon V in play, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

data.name: Pikachu
data.flavorText: Pikachu that can generate powerful electricity have cheek sacs that are extra soft and super stretchy.

attacks.name: Buddy Bolt
attacks.text: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Onix
data.flavorText: As it digs through the ground, it absorbs many hard objects. This is what makes its body so solid.

attacks.name: Rock Tomb
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Raging Swing
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.name: Alolan Rattata
data.flavorText: Night after night, they sneak into people's homes seeking food. A massive outbreak of them has become an issue of public concern.

attacks.name: Hyper Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Meltan
data.flavorText: It melts particles of iron and other metals found in the subsoil, so it can absorb them into its body of molten steel.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Melmetal VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Juggernaut
attacks.text: This attack does 60 more damage for each extra Metal Energy attached to this Pokémon (in addition to this attack's cost). You can't add more than 120 damage in this way.

data.name: Snorlax
data.flavorText: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.

abilities.name: Block
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent's Active Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Collapse
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Dragonite VSTAR
rules: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

attacks.name: Draconic Star
attacks.text: Look at the top 12 cards of your deck and attach any number of Water or Lightning Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

data.name: Ditto
data.flavorText: It can reconstitute its entire cellular structure to change into what it sees, but it returns to normal when it relaxes.

abilities.name: Sudden Transformation
abilities.text: This Pokémon can use the attacks of any Basic Pokémon in your discard pile, except for Pokémon with a Rule Box (Pokémon V, Pokémon-GX, etc. have Rule Boxes). (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

data.name: Eevee
data.flavorText: It has the ability to alter the composition of its body to suit its surrounding environment.

attacks.name: Whiny Voice
attacks.text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

data.name: Aipom
data.flavorText: It searches for prey from the tops of trees. When it spots its favorite food, Bounsweet, Aipom gets excited and pounces.

attacks.name: Bustle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

data.name: Ambipom
data.flavorText: It uses its tails for everything. If it wraps both of its tails around you and gives you a squeeze, that's proof it really likes you.

abilities.name: Primate Dexterity
abilities.text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.

attacks.name: Full Tilt Fling
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

data.name: PokéStop
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may discard 3 cards from the top of their deck. If a player discarded any Item cards in this way, they put those Item cards into their hand.

data.name: Rare Candy
rules: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 2 card in your hand that evolves from that Pokémon, put that card onto the Basic Pokémon to evolve it, skipping the Stage 1. You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Basic Pokémon that was put into play this turn.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Alolan Exeggutor V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Growing Tall
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for up to 5 Grass Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Head Swing
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon for each Grass Energy attached to this Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Melmetal V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Arm Charge
attacks.text: You may attach a Metal Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon.

data.name: Slaking V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Kinda Lazy
abilities.text: If you have exactly 2, 4, or 6 Prize cards remaining, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Slaking V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Kinda Lazy
abilities.text: If you have exactly 2, 4, or 6 Prize cards remaining, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Professor's Research
data.flavorText: Professor Willow
rules: Discard your hand and draw 7 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Lure Module
rules: Each player reveals the top 3 cards of their deck and puts all Pokémon they find there into their hand. Then, each player shuffles the other cards back into their deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Bidoof
data.flavorText: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Pidove
data.flavorText: Where people go, these Pokémon follow. If you're scattering food for them, be careful— several hundred of them can gather at once.

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 20 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Egg Incubator
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Basic Pokémon, put it onto your Bench, and shuffle your deck. If tails, put this Egg Incubator on the bottom of your deck instead of in the discard pile.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Conkeldurr V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Counter
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does that much more damage.

attacks.name: Dynamic Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 90 more damage, and your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Mewtwo VSTAR
rules: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Psy Purge
attacks.text: Discard up to 3 Psychic Energy from your Pokémon. This attack does 90 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Star Raid
attacks.text: This attack does 120 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon V. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

data.name: Blanche
rules: Draw 2 cards. If you drew any cards in this way, flip a coin. If heads, attach a Water Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Candela
rules: Draw 2 cards. If you drew any cards in this way, flip a coin. If heads, attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Egg Incubator
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Basic Pokémon, put it onto your Bench, and shuffle your deck. If tails, put this Egg Incubator on the bottom of your deck instead of in the discard pile.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Blissey
data.flavorText: Whenever a Blissey finds a weakened Pokémon, it will share its egg and offer its care until the other Pokémon is all better.

attacks.name: Enriching Egg
attacks.text: Heal all damage from 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Tranquill
data.flavorText: It can fly moderately quickly. No matter how far it travels, it can always find its way back to its master and its nest.

attacks.name: Aerial Ace
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Unfezant
data.flavorText: Unfezant are exceptional fliers. The females are known for their stamina, while the males outclass them in terms of speed.

attacks.name: Hurricane Wing
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 70 damage for each heads.

data.name: Blanche
rules: Draw 2 cards. If you drew any cards in this way, flip a coin. If heads, attach a Water Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Lure Module
rules: Each player reveals the top 3 cards of their deck and puts all Pokémon they find there into their hand. Then, each player shuffles the other cards back into their deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Spark
rules: Draw 2 cards. If you drew any cards in this way, flip a coin. If heads, attach a Lightning Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Conkeldurr V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Counter
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does that much more damage.

attacks.name: Dynamic Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 90 more damage, and your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Professor's Research
data.flavorText: Professor Willow
rules: Discard your hand and draw 7 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Melmetal VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Juggernaut
attacks.text: This attack does 60 more damage for each extra Metal Energy attached to this Pokémon (in addition to this attack's cost). You can't add more than 120 damage in this way.

data.name: Spark
rules: Draw 2 cards. If you drew any cards in this way, flip a coin. If heads, attach a Lightning Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Mewtwo VSTAR
rules: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Psy Purge
attacks.text: Discard up to 3 Psychic Energy from your Pokémon. This attack does 90 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Star Raid
attacks.text: This attack does 120 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon V. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

data.name: Chansey
data.flavorText: The egg Chansey carries is not only delicious but also packed with nutrition. It's used as a high-class cooking ingredient.

attacks.name: Delicious Egg
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Bibarel
data.flavorText: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.

abilities.name: Reassuring Dam
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, cards in your deck can't be discarded by effects of your opponent's attacks, Abilities, Item cards, or Supporter cards.

data.name: Candela
rules: Draw 2 cards. If you drew any cards in this way, flip a coin. If heads, attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Mewtwo V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Transfer Break
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Dragonite V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Dragonite VSTAR
rules: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

attacks.name: Draconic Star
attacks.text: Look at the top 12 cards of your deck and attach any number of Water or Lightning Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)
